thread.title: Baby you can drive my truck: Paul McCartney delivers private performance to trucking group
thread.title_full: Baby you can drive my truck: Paul McCartney delivers private performance to trucking group

title: Baby you can drive my truck: Paul McCartney delivers private performance to trucking group
text:
Enlarge Image 
FILE - In this June 19, 2015 file photo, Paul McCartney performs on Day 2 of the 2015 Firefly Music Festival at The Woodlands in Dover, Del. McCartney gave a private performance in Philadelphia last Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015 during the American Trucking Association’s Management Conference and Exhibition. McCartney changed the lyrics to the Beatles song “Drive My Car” to play to the crowd of about 1,000. (Photo by Owen Sweeney/Invision/AP) 
PHILADELPHIA - "Baby you can drive my truck." Yeah, you heard right. 
Paul McCartney gave a private performance in Philadelphia last weekend during the American Trucking Association's Management Conference and Exhibition. 
McCartney changed the lyrics to the Beatles song "Drive My Car" to play to the crowd of about 1,000, according to the industry newspaper, Transport Topics. The paper says McCartney played the two-hour show at a customer appreciation dinner given by Freightliner Trucks on Sunday. 
McCartney's wife, Nancy Shevell, is an executive at Elizabeth, New Jersey-based New England Motor Freight, a trucking firm owned by her father. 
McCartney made other trucking references throughout the show, but his song list was based mostly on his more than 50-year career with the Beatles and solo career.
